info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 8:18PM EDT until May 28 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River Near Fletcher affecting Buncombe and Henderson Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...French Broad River Near Fletcher. * WHEN...From this evening to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, Action Stage/Advisory flooding continues. Butler Bridge Rd. is inundated with up to 6 inches of floodwaters from the French Broad River, forcing road closure. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:01 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 8.8 feet and rising steadily.. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
